contacts.name: Adeo Ressi
contacts.emailSubject: Pivot Pyramid — already featured on FI blog
contacts.emailBody:
Hi Adeo,

Hope you're well!

As a fellow FI mentor, I wanted to share something I've been working on.

After my second startup Boostable, while I was investing and mentoring at 500 Startups, I developed a mental framework called the Pivot Pyramid to help startups think about how to pivot and experiment. It got picked up by VentureBeat and the 500 blog at the time.

Recently, I noticed the framework has been cited organically in several places — including on the Founders Institute blog (https://fi.co/insight/what-pivoting-is-when-to-pivot-and-how-to-pivot-effectively), which was a nice surprise.

So I decided to polish it into a proper framework and ebook. I'm also building an AI agent and canvas editor to help founders put the framework into practice.

The core idea: not all pivots are created equal. There's a hierarchy — Customer → Problem → Solution → Technology → Growth — and understanding where you are determines how to pivot effectively.

Given it's already resonating with the FI community, would you be open to exploring a more formal integration into the curriculum? Happy to share the draft and demo the tools.

Best,
Selcuk
contacts.background: Founder & CEO of Founders Institute — the world's largest pre-seed startup accelerator. FI operates globally with a standardized curriculum for early-stage founders.
contacts.relationship: Fellow FI mentor. Selcuk is part of the FI mentor network.

contacts.emailBody:
Dear Eric,

"The Lean Startup" changed how I build companies.

After my second startup Boostable, while I was investing and mentoring at 500, I developed a mental framework called the Pivot Pyramid to help startups think about how to pivot and experiment. It got picked up by VentureBeat and the 500 blog at the time.

- Playbooks for each type of pivot
